page.title: 06Finchingfield Church.
page.content: The church is called Saint John the Baptist. The oldest part of the church is the tower which is 800 years old. There are eight bells.Which are regularly rung.The clock on the church has to be wound up two times a week. Along the south side towards the east there is a small doorway which enters into the Berners chapel.This was built in the 16th century. There is a porch on the south with a carved door dating back to 1370 which serves as the main entrance. There is a beautifully carved rood screen which divides the nave from the chancel. About 50 people a week attend the communion service on Sunday and about 200 midnight mass on Chistmas Eve.The church is on a hill above the famous, picturesque duck pond and green so popular with tourists.
